result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING  (13 pages) commencing 08-09-22 by KRISTIN MENZIA.

Defendant John Paul Roberson in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Defendant John Paul Roberson in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer M. Arango. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment date. Case is adjourned to Branch 19.  Arraignment scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $5,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  24 hour curfew with the exception of verified employment, court and legal appointments. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant John Paul Roberson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant John Paul Roberson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John Paul Roberson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 4506 North 41st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
